description:
Faravahar
The Winged Disk, Symbol of Divine Glory
The most recognizable symbol of Zoroastrianism, depicting a winged figure representing the human soul and divine glory (khvarenah).

description:
Sacred Fire (Atar)
Divine Light, Son of Ahura Mazda
Fire as the supreme symbol of divine wisdom, purity, and truth. Sacred fires burn continuously in Zoroastrian temples.
